verbs.description: undoctor (third-person singular simple present undoctors, present participle undoctoring, simple past and past participle undoctored)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To divest of the character or status of a doctor.
examples: My brother-in-law is a paragon of the class, but he is so by—in as much as possible—undoctoring himself.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To restore (something illicitly altered) to its correct form.
examples: If their accountants are undoctoring the books properly, there's evidence he's ripped off something close to two million bucks on this Arizona thing alone.
